intro: Into privacy, politics, philosphy and raspberry pies.

post.body: Hello ZeroMe!
How cool is that, I can follow myself. Now I will never forget what I was posting
Don't forget to donate to keep this project alive: https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/help_zeronet/donate/

I finally got ZeroNet running on my Raspberry Pi and can access it from any device on my wifi now. I guess I am one of the first mobile users :)

Here is how:

*On your Pi*

sudo apt-get install python-dev python-pip
sudo pip install gevent --upgrade
sudo pip install msgpack-python --upgrade

wget https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/archive/master.tar.gz

tar -xzvf master.tar.gz
cd ZeroNet-master
python zeronet.py --ui_ip YOUR_RASPBERRYPI_IP_ADDRESS

*On mobile or PC*

open http://YOUR_RASPBERRYPI_IP_ADDRESS:43110/

ZeroNet needs to get optimised for mobile screens. In chrome for android it does not work at all and I am writing this text in Firefox right now. The reply button for comments and the edit button are not visible.
Are there any ZeroNet sites for ebook torrents?

Being on ZeroNet is like watching the birth of a star.

New interesting, inspiring people every day. It's been ages since I was so occupied with a social network.
Is it possible to have a search function on a ZeroBlog? Or clone the ZeroTorrent site design? Forgive me, I only know a little bit about python and html, the rest I still need to learn
Can anyone advise me on the size limits allowed for a zite? I made a site with roughly 700MB and am still figuring out how to add it to ZeroNet...
How can I change the name that appears for my site on ZeroHello? Currently it only shows the site address :(
@Nofish: I would appreciate it if there was an option to get notified once someone replies to a post to which I replied earlier (currently I only get notified when someone quotes me with @name).
Can anyone access http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtFS31Q11swyo1zWLmyxZRafBSbu86SeL
Is there any way to forward ZeroNet to a port other than 15441? I cannot use it for some reason :(
Is there a size limit on the content.json file? If yes, how can I override it? It is a pain to get a site published, this really needs to become easier.

ZeroLeaks |Bringing you the Snowden files| is up and running: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/

Click on the images to open the pdfs (and be patient, there are 545 of them). 

Please share the love and help seeding :)
If there are any people who have purchased an Ubuntu phone, what are your thoughts on it?

**ZeroLeaks has been updated** 

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/

*New SIDtoday section.* 

From [The Intercept]("https://theintercept.com/snowden-sidtoday/"):

SIDtoday is the internal newsletter for the NSA’s most important division, the Signals Intelligence Directorate. After editorial review, The Intercept is releasing nine years’ worth of newsletters in batches, starting with 2003. The agency’s spies explain a surprising amount about what they were doing, how they were doing it, and why.
Updated the site design on ZeroLeakz, let me know what you think :) http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/

Please recommend me some Jazz gems. 

My suggestion for you: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_BlHRPXPx-4

@Nofish, I would appreciate if you could turn off the "Hello ZeroMe!" notification whenever someone new joins ZeroMe or give me the ability to hide it. Now I am happy whenever someone joins, but it is cluttering my wall. You could display the latest new users on the left hand side of the screen instead or just drop the feature.

upvote

Great stuff :) Are notifications for comments/likes in the pipeline?
@FraYoshi: Thanks for the suggestion :)

@Method-X: Closing the circle, right :)
@Method-X: :D Back in the days when porn was shared on external hard drives at LAN partys. Oh well kids, anyone knows what a LAN party is...
Nice stuff, I like these dots. Update: I found a lot of replies I had not noticed haha :D
I am sorry man, I didn't see your psosts earlier - I've downloaded the iso and give it a try once I have time to spare
@GomZik: You will see them on the start page of ZeroNet, I found replies from yesterday
@GomZik: Noo :( for me it works man. Can you update again, check the console to see that it actually does update. Refresh the web page, or close ZeroNet entirely and then re-open it
@GomZik: And have you actually clicked on the dots and checked both options
click on your user name and then "+ Follow"
@GomZik: lol it also took me a while to find out. @Nofish: can't you enable this option by default please? I guess everyone will use this feature
@Sirenyc: Or enabled by default with opt-out, I guess most people would like to use this feature.

@Sirenyc: We agree that in one or the other way people need to be made aware of this feature, especially new users when they are entering ZeroMe. In all social networks I know it is normal that you get notified for mentions or replies, so why not here. ;)

I'd love a page like that. I been thinking about an upload page where people can paste the IBAN or the goodreads link when uploading a book and that could be used to scrape info form other pages. I know how to scrape with python
About the IPFS part - what is its advantage over magnet links? I guess the latter brings more seeders?
@Kaffie: Thank you , I'll see what I can do :)

@Arsene Lupin: Thanks for explaining, I do not know much about IPFS yet. If you upload a file there, who will host it? Is it broken down in several parts like on Maidsafe? How liable is a storage provider on IFPS for the files that are stored by the network on his PC?

Dual Boot may be the answer, so you can slowly wean yourself off. Or run it in a virtual machine if you are not gaming...with good hardware you can even use Photoshop in a W7 VM. Check out Antergos, it's easy enough for new Linux users and brings you a rolling release cycle as it is based off arch. No painful re-installations for new OS versions anymore and bleeding edge software. If you want to use the latest features of desktop environments like Gnome or KDE for a vanilla feeling with minimal bloatware, don't use Ubuntu or its derivatives like mint

@Tkarita: @PaintNinja: Thanks for this info guys, is there any tutorial for beginners? I am just learning html, css and python and java still puzzles me a bit. The site is ready I just need to move it onto ZeroNet ;)

Found the link, it is http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/site_development/content_json/#optional

@Tkarita: @FraYoshi: Ahaha yes corrected. So I know I can add these optional files, but even without optional files it will be like 31MB big. This is the bare minimum - if users are accesssing the site, would they automatically  informed about that the size is bigger than 10MB and asked to increase their limit?

@Tkarita: Nice. I need to make sure I understand that with the optional files: Basically, I create the site, add my data to the respective folders, publish the modifications and it generates the content.json with all files added in there. Next, I would need to edit the json and move the files that shall become optional from "files" to "files_optional"? Plus publish again of course.
@Tkarita: OMG that must be porn lol
Do you know 2001 Odyssey in Space? It is an oldie but goldie. Or The Abyss

Is there any way of hiding the uploader's name or making it anonymous?

Brilliant idea - you could get a raspberry pi. I can confirm it works well and you can even host zeronet on it, plus remote in from your PC via VNC and deluge remote. If you have questions about setting it up, just let me know :)
@Musickiller: With gems I mean great songs I should have listened to.

@Musickiller: What if you get a second hand PC and use that? Any PC sold nowadays should be sufficient - and you could run a low power OS on it, e.g. Ubuntu Mate, Lubuntu or Puppy (there are many). running 24 hours a PC will eat far more electricity though...ARM processors like in mobiles and the pi are much more power effective. I don't know where you live but I believed raspberrys are cheap everywhere?
